translated: which, when done, one does not regret;
having washed their feet,🔽they sat to one side.

analyzed: rattiyā purime yāme  pubba jāti manussaru
translated: In the first part of the night,🔽they remembered their past lives;
in the middle part of the night,
in the last part of the night,
they broke the mass of darkness.
Having gotten up, they worshipped at her feet,
Just as the gods of the Thirty-three,🔽Indra, the unconquered in battle,
we will live with him at the head,
we are the three knowledges, without pollutants.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ tiṁsamattā therī bhikkhuniyo paṭācārāya santike aññaṁ byākariṁsūti.
analyzed: ittham sudam tisamattāḥ therī bhikkhuniyo paṭācārāya santike aññam byākarisu ti
translated: Thus have I heard. These thirty elder bhikkhunis declared their enlightenment in the presence of the Elder Nun Paṭācārā.
